Detailed Description

This class represents the objective functional of a multilayer perceptron for the geodesic problem. The geodesic problem for the multilayer perceptron is a variational problem with one input and one output variables, two boundary conditions and where evaluation of the objective functional is obtained by integrating a function.

See also:
ObjectiveFunctional.

OrdinaryDifferentialEquations.

Definition at line 33 of file GeodesicProblem.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::GeodesicProblem::GeodesicProblem ( MultilayerPerceptron *  newMultilayerPerceptron  ) 

General constructor. It creates a geodesic problem objective functional associated to a multilayer perceptron. It also initializes all the problem parameters to their default values:

  • xA = 0.0.
  • yA = 1.0.
  • xB = 1.0.
  • yB = 0.0.
  • Tolerance = 1.0e-12.
  • Initial size = 1000.

Parameters:
newMultilayerPerceptron Pointer to a multilayer perceptron object.

Definition at line 43 of file GeodesicProblem.cpp.

References Flood::MultilayerPerceptron::getNumberOfInputs(), Flood::MultilayerPerceptron::getNumberOfOutputs(), initialSize, Flood::ObjectiveFunctional::multilayerPerceptron, ordinaryDifferentialEquations, Flood::OrdinaryDifferentialEquations::setInitialSize(), Flood::OrdinaryDifferentialEquations::setTolerance(), tolerance, xA, xB, yA, and yB.

Flood::GeodesicProblem::GeodesicProblem ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates a geodesic problem objective functional not associated to any multilayer perceptron. It also initializes all the problem parameters to their default values:

  • xA = 0.0.
  • yA = 1.0.
  • xB = 1.0.
  • yB = 0.0.
  • Tolerance = 1.0e-12.
  • Initial size = 1000.

Vector< double > Flood::GeodesicProblem::calculateParticularSolution ( Vector< double >  input  ) 

This method returns the particular solution term in order to satisfy the boundary conditions in the geodesic problem. It holds phi0(a)=ya if there is a condition y(a)=ya.

Parameters:
input Value of independent variable x.
See also:
calculateHomogeneousSolution.

Vector< double > Flood::GeodesicProblem::calculateHomogeneousSolution ( Vector< double >  input  ) 

This method returns the homogeneous solution term in order to satisfy the boundary conditions in the geodesic problem. It must hold phi1(a)=0 if there is a condition y(a)=ya.

Parameters:
input Value of independent variable x.
See also:

Vector< double > Flood::GeodesicProblem::calculateParticularSolutionDerivative ( Vector< double >  input  ) 

This method returns the derivative of the particular solution term for the boundary conditions. It is used to calculate the derivative y'(x)=dy/dx.

Parameters:
input Value of independent variable x.

double Flood::GeodesicProblem::calculateArcLength ( void   ) 

This method integrates the arc length integrand function to obtain the arc length between xa and xb of the function represented by the neural network. It uses the Runge-Kutta-Fehlberg method.

See also:
calculateArcLengthIntegrand.
